title: How to Unlink a Form on Google Sheets

steps.title: Open Google Sheets in an internet browser.
steps.content: Open Google Sheets in an internet browser. Type sheets.google.com into your browser's address bar, and hit ↵ Enter or ⏎ Return on your keyboard.

steps.title: Click the spreadsheet file you want to unlink.
steps.content: Click the spreadsheet file you want to unlink. Find the file you want to edit on the list of your saved spreadsheets, and open it.

steps.title: Click the Form tab.
steps.content: Click the Form tab. This button is located between Tools and Add-ons below your spreadsheet file's name on the top-left. It will open a drop-down menu. If you don't see the Form tab here, click Insert , and select Form on the menu. The Form tab will now show up on the tabs bar.

steps.title: Click Unlink form on the Form menu.
steps.content: Click Unlink form on the Form menu. You will have to confirm your action in a new pop-up window.

steps.title: Click the blue OK button in the confirmation pop-up.
steps.content: Click the blue OK button in the confirmation pop-up. This will confirm your action, and unlink your form from this spreadsheet. New answers on the form will no longer automatically go to your spreadsheet.
